publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1016 Dr Jean Turner: Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotlandâ€”That the Parliament recognises that non-gender-specific rape is currently not a crime in Scotland; supports the stance of the Scottish Youth Parliament on this issue, and supports a change in legislation to include non-gender-specific rape as a crime. Supported by: Elaine Smith*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Frances Curran*, Michael Matheson*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Tommy Sheridan*, Dennis Canavan*

S2M-1016 Dr Jean Turner: Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland-That the Parliament recognises that non-gender-specific rape is currently not a crime in Scotland; supports the stance of the Scottish Youth Parliament on this issue, and supports a change in legislation to include non-gender-specific rape as a crime. Supported by: Elaine Smith, Carolyn Leckie, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Frances Curran, Michael Matheson, Tommy Sheridan, Dennis Canavan, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Robin Harper*, Trish Godman*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Shiona Baird*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Mark Ballard*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Chris Ballance*
S2M-1016 Non-Gender-Specific Rape as a Crime in Scotland (lodged on 9 March 2004) Rosie Kane*
